author: Special Correspondent
text:
The district administration has launched a special campaign through school students in an attempt to reach out to voters to highlight the importance of exercising their franchise.

The Election Commission has been looking to reach out to electors through different ways, the latest initiative is aimed at reaching the homes of voters through children.

Under the initiative, letters are sent to the parents of school students asking them to verify whether their names have been included in the electoral rolls and also to exercise their franchise without fail. “Steps have been taken to send the letters through the Chief Educational Officer to parents of students in all schools,” District Collector K.S.Palanisamy said after launching the initiative on Monday.

He distributed posters and the model letters to be sent to the parents to about 50 school children. The letters would carry slogans such as : “My name is in the attendance register; does the voters list have your name” and “I read daily without fail; you too vote without fail.”
title: Bid to reach out to voters
